Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery jar, the interior is grooved, the exterior is covered with a burnished light-brown slip and remains of fourteen lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393509) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393509)
Almásy-Martin 2020 / Demotic, Greek and Coptic ostraca from Abydos in the British Museum (no.32)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.BM Abydos Copt. 2 (Edition abbreviation according to Oates et al. 2001)
